collect.title: Simoni Mtakatifu na Yuda Mtakatifu
collect.collect: Mwenyezi Mungu, uliyelijenga kanisa lako juu ya msingi wa Mitume na Manabii, Yesu Kristo mwenyewe akiwa jiwe Kuu la pembeni: utujalie tuungamanishwe katika umoja wa Roho kwa elimu yao, ili tufanywe hekalu takatifu lenye kibali kwako; kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.
collect.post_communion_rubric: Baada ya Ushirika wa Mitume na Wainjilisti
collect.post_communion_prayer: Mungu mwenye enzi, ambaye katika siku ya Pentekosti ulimtuma Roho wako Mtakatifu kwao mitume pamoja na upepo wa mbinguni na katika ndimi za moto, ukawajaza furaha na ujasiri wa kuihubiri Injili: twakusihi kwamba kwa nguvu za Roho huyo, utupatie nasi uwezo wa kuishuhudia kweli yako na kuwavuta wote katika moto wa upendo wako, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

Bwana Mungu, uliye chimbuko la ukweli na upendo, utusaidie tuwe waaminifu kwa mafundisho ya Mitume, tukiungana katika kuomba na kuumega mkate, na katika furaha na unyofu wa moyo, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu, Amin.

collect.title: Andrea Mtakatifu
collect.collect: Mwenyezi Mungu, uliyempa neema Andrea, Mtume wako Mtakatifu, hata akautii mara wito wa Mwanao Yesu Kristo, na akamleta na nduguye pia: utujalie sisi sote, hali tumeitwa na Neno lako takatifu tuitangaze habari njema ya ufalme, tujitoe nafsi zetu mara kwa utii, tuyatimize maagizo yako matakatifu, kwa Yesu Kristo Mwana wako Bwana wetu, aishiye na kutawala pamoja nawe, katika umoja wa Roho Mtakatifu, Mungu mmoja daima, sasa hata milele. Amin.
collect.post_communion_rubric: Baada ya Ushirika wa Mitume na Wainjilisti
collect.post_communion_prayer: Mungu mwenye enzi, ambaye katika siku ya Pentekosti ulimtuma Roho wako Mtakatifu kwao mitume pamoja na upepo wa mbinguni na katika ndimi za moto, ukawajaza furaha na ujasiri wa kuihubiri Injili: twakusihi kwamba kwa nguvu za Roho huyo, utupatie nasi uwezo wa kuishuhudia kweli yako na kuwavuta wote katika moto wa upendo wako, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

Bwana Mungu, uliye chimbuko la ukweli na upendo, utusaidie tuwe waaminifu kwa mafundisho ya Mitume, tukiungana katika kuomba na kuumega mkate, na katika furaha na unyofu wa moyo, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu, Amin.

collect.title: Mtakatifu Stefano
collect.collect: Baba wa neema, uliyempa Stefano, mfia imani wa kwanza, neema ya kuwaombea wale waliokuwa wakimuua: utujalie kwamba katika mateso yetu yote tujifunze kwa kweli kuwapenda adui zetu na kuwatakia msamaha wale wanaotafuta kutudhuru, tukimtukuza juu mbinguni Yeye aliyesulibiwa kwa ajili yetu, Yesu Kristo, mpatanishi na Mwombezi wetu, aishiye na kutawala pamoja nawe katika umoja wa Roho Mtakatifu, Mungu mmoja, sasa hata milele. Amin.
collect.post_communion_prayer: Bwana mwenye rehema, twakushukuru kwa sababu ya dalili za huruma zako zinazodhihirishwa katika uzazi na kifo: utuokoe kwa kuja kwa mwanao, utupe furaha tunapomkumbuka Stephano, shahidi wa kwanza wa Israeli mpya, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

collect.title: Yohana Mtakatifu
collect.collect: Bwana mwenye rehema, twakusihi uliangaze kanisa lako kwa nuru yako kuu, ili likimulikiwa kwa mafundisho ya Mtume mbarikiwa, Mwinjilisti wako, Yohana Mtakatifu, nasi pia tuenende katika nuru ya kweli yako, hata mwisho tufikie nuru ya uzima wa milele; kwa Yesu Kristo aliyefanyika mwanadamu Bwana wetu, aishiye na kutawala pamoja nawe, katika umoja wa Roho Mtakatifu, Mungu mmoja, sasa hata milele. Amin.
collect.post_communion_prayer: Utujalie, Ee Bwana, twakuomba, kwamba Neno aliyefanyika mwili na kutangazwa na Mtume Yohana, akae nasi daima tunapoadhimisha siri hizi takatifu, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

collect.title: Siku ya Wasio na Hatia
collect.collect: Baba wa mbinguni, ambaye watoto wako waliteswa kwa amri ya Herode, ingawa hawakuwa na hatia: twakusihi, kwa ajili ya kuteswa kwa mwanao, na kwa usafi wa maisha yetu, uzipinge hila zote mbaya, na uukuze utawala wako wa haki na amani, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu, aishiye na kutawala pamoja nawe katika umoja wa Roho Mtakatifu, Mungu mmoja, sasa hata milele. Amin.
collect.post_communion_prayer: Bwana Yesu Kristo, ambaye kwa unyenyekevu wako umejishusha kushiriki ubinadamu pamoja na wale walio dhaifu zaidi kati ya watoto wako: tujalie nasi tuliopokea vipawa hivi vya mateso yako, tufurahi na kushangilia ushahidi wa watoto wasio na hatia, katika usafi wa dhabihu ile iliyotolewa mara moja tu msalabani, kwa kuwa u hai na unatawala sasa hata milele. Amin.

collect.title: Hafla ya kuweka Wakfu
collect.collect: Mungu Mwenyezi, ambaye kwa utukufu wako twasherehekea kuwekwa wakfu kwa nyumba hii ya Sala: twakusifu; kwa ajili ya baraka nyingi unazowapa wale wakuabuduo mahali hapa: na tunaomba kwamba wote wakutafutao mahali hapa wakuone, na huku wakijazwa Roho Mtakatifu. wawe hekalu linaloishi, linalokubalika nawe, kwa Yesu Kristo Mwana wako, Bwana wetu, aishiye na kutawala pamoja nawe katika umoja wa Roho Mtakatifu, Mungu mmoja sasa hata milele. Amin.
collect.post_communion_prayer: Baba wa mbinguni, ambaye kanisa lako duniani ni alama ya amani iliyoko mbinguni, mfano wa Yerusalemu mpya ya milele: tujalie wakati wa safari yetu, tunapolishwa kwa mkate wa mbinguni na kuunganishwa katika mwili wa mwanao, tuwe hekalu lako, mahali pa utukufu wako duniani, na alama ya amani yako ulimwenguni, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

collect.title: Shukrani ya Mavuno
collect.collect_rubric: Shukrani ya mavuno inaweza kuadhimishwa katika jumapili mwezi wa Oktoba au mwezi wowote wa mavuno, па inaweza kuchukua mahali pa Sala ya siku hiyo, mradi isichukue mahali pa Sala ya Karamu Kuu au Sherehe.
collect.collect: Mungu wa Milele, unaufunika mwaka na wema wako na unatupa matunda ya ardhi kwa msimu wake: utujalie tuweze kuyatumia kwa utukufu wako, kwa faraja ya wale walio na haja na kwa uzima wetu; ikupendeze watu wako wafurahie mapato ya mavuno yao, kwa utulivu na amani; bila ya magonjwa au maafa mengine kwa Yesu Kristo, Mwanao aishiye na kutawala pamoja nawe katika umoja wa Roho Mtakatifu, Mungu mmoja sasa na hata milele. Amin.
collect.post_communion_prayer: Bwana wa Mavuno kwa furaha tumetoa shukrani kwa ajili ya upendo wako kwa viumbe vyako, na tumeshiriki katika mkate na Divai ya ufalme wako, kwa neema yako panda mioyoni mwetu kicho kwa yale yote unayotupa, na utufanye kuwa mawakili wakarimu na wenye busara juu ya vitu tunavyovifurahia, kwa Yesu Kristo Bwana wetu. Amin.

section.title: Notes
section.item: The psalms of the day are sung or read antiphonally.
Songs/canticles' may be sung or said antiphonally.
An alternative declaration of pardon as well as an alternative form of benediction are provided for use by a lay minister in the absence of a minister.

Offering: In this as well as other services, the leader is encouraged to first exhort the Christians give generously for the Lord's work by reading and explaining texts related to giving and stewardship.

section.rubric: At the entry of the procession the people stand. A hymn is sung after which the people remain standing and the leader welcomes them with the following words.
section.item: The Lord be with you.
And also with you.

We have come together, the people of God, drawn by his Spirit, longing for his word, to praise the holy name of the Lord, to share his glorious news of grace, to pray for our needs and the pain of the world, to rejoice in his love and be sent into his peace.
We are heirs of the Father;
joint heirs with the son,
renewed in the spirit,
together we are one.

section.title: Sentences
section.rubric: One or more of these sentences may be said after the introduction.
section.item: Ezekiel 18:27If a wicked man turns away from the wickedness he has committed and does what is just and right, he will save his life.
Joel 2:13Rend your heart and not your garments. Return to the Lord your God for he is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in love, and he relents from sending calamity.
Psalm 37:4Delight yourself in the Lord and he will give you the desires of your heart.
Psalm 36:9For with you is the fountain of life; in your light we see light.
Psalm 84:2My soul yearns, even faints, for the courts of the Lord; My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
Psalm 63:1God you are my God, early will I seek you: O God, you are my God, earnestly I seek you; my sould thirsts for you, my body longs for you.
Psalm 73:25Whom have I in heaven but you? And earth has nothing I desire besides you.
Isaiah 1;16-17Wash and make yourself clean. Take your evil deeds out of my sight! Stop doing wrong and learn to do right!
Isaiah 2:3"Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord,... he will teach us his ways so that we may walk in his paths."
Isaiah 65:24Before they call I will answer; while they are still speaking I will hear.'
Isaiah 66:2This is the one I esteem: he who is humble and contrite in spirit and trembles at my word.
Micah 6:8And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.
Matthew 5:17Do not think that I have come to abolish the law or the prophets; I have not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.

Luke 6:20-22Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God. Blessed are you who hunger, for you will be satisfied. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh. Blessed are you when people hate you,... because great is your reward in heaven.
Luke 12:32Fear not, little flock, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
Luke 15:7"I tell you there will be more rejoicing in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous persons who do not need to repent."
Luke 15:18"Father, I have sinned against heaven and against you. I am no longer worthy to be called your son."

If we say that we have no sin we deceive ourselves and the truth is not in us. If we confess our sins, in repentance and trust, God is faithful and just, and will forgive us our sins. So let us confess them to our Father.
People kneel.

Eternal Father, God of our ancestors, before your power all things tremble, but through your son, we approach your throne. We have done wrong and neglected to do right; our sins weigh heavily on our hearts: Lord have mercy, count them not against us. Grant us the joy of forgiveness and lighten our hearts with the glory of Christ, who died and rose again for us. Amen.

The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ rejoices at repentance and declares his acceptance. The dead are alive, the lost are found. His goodness and mercy will follow you all the days of your life, and you will live in the house of the Lord for ever.
Amen.

section.rubric: When a minister is not present the lay leader is to use the following prayer.
section.item: Lord of mercy, grant us your pardon and peace; that cleansed from our sins and with peace in our hearts, we may be free to serve you; through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
Amen.
Blessed are those who live in your house.
They will always be singing your praise.
Praise the Lord.
The name of the Lord be praised.

section.rubric: People stand.
section.item: Glory to the Father in whom all things began.
Glory to the Son who became the Son of Man, Glory to the Spirit who inspires and renews. The Lord our God for ever! Alleluia!

section.rubric: Between Christmas and Epiphany Sunday, and between Easter Day and Pentecost Sunday, the following version of the Gloria may be said instead of the above.
section.item: The glorious Son of God on high
is born for us through Mary's womb:
The homeless Prince of Peace on earth
is crushed and lies in Joseph's tomb
The reigning Lord of Life and death
breaks the bonds of time and doom.

section.title: Jubilate Song, Vinite, or the Song of Habakkuk

item.title: Jubilate Song (Song of Joy)
item.stanza: I will enter his gates with thanksgiving in my heart:
I will enter his courts with praise.
I will say this is the day that the Lord has made:
I will rejoice for he has made me glad.
He has made me glad, he has made me glad:
I will rejoice for he has made me glad.
He has made me glad, he has made me glad:
I will rejoice for he has made me glad.

item.title: Venite (Song of Triumph)
item.stanza: O come, let us sing out to the Lord;
let us shout in triumph to the Rock of our salvation.
Let us come before his face with thanksgiving:
and cry to him joyfully in psalms.
For the Lord is a great God:
and a great King above all gods.
In his hand are the depths of the earth:
and the peaks of the mountains are his also.
The sea is his and he made it:
his hands moulded dry land.
Come let us worship and bow down:
and kneel before the Lord our maker.
For he is the Lord our God:
we are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
If only you would hear his voice today:
for he comes to judge the earth.
He shall judge the world with righteousness:
and the peoples with his truth.

item.title: Song of Habakkuk
item.stanza: Though the mango tree does not blossom
nor the fruit be on the vines,
the crop of the coconut fails,
and the fields yield no food,
Though the flock be cut off from the fold.
and there be no herd in the stall,
yet I will rejoice in the Lord,
I will be joyful in the God of my salvation
Glory to the Father, Son and the Holy Spirit: as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

section.title: Psalm of the Day
section.rubric: The PSALM appointed for the day may be sung or said antiphonally and should end with:
section.item: Glory to the Father, Son and the Holy Spirit: as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

section.title: FIRST READING from the Old Testament
section.rubric: At the end of the reading the reader says:
section.item: This is the word of the Lord.
Thanks be to God.

section.title: Song of the Messiah, Song of Zecharaiah, or the Song of Paul

item.title: Song of the Messiah
item.stanza: Jesus the Seed of Abraham blesses the nations:
Jesus the Prophet like Moses frees the oppressed:
Jesus the Lord of King David leads his people:
Jesus the Servant of the Lord suffers and Saves:
Jesus the Son of Man destroyed and raised.
Glory to the Father, Son, and the Holy Spirit; as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

item.title: Song of Zecharaiah
item.stanza: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel:
for he has come to his people and set them free.
He has raised up for us a mighty Saviour:
born of the house of his servant David.
Through his holy prophets he promised of old:
that he would save us from our enemies,
from the hands of all that hate us.
He promised to show mercy to our fathers:
and to remember his holy covenant.
This was the oath he swore to our father Abraham:
to set us free from the hands of our enemies,
Free to worship him without fear: holy and righteous
in his sight all the days of our life.
You my child shall be called the prophet of the Most High:
for you will go before the Lord to prepare his way,
to give his people knowledge of salvation
by the forgiveness of all their sins.
In the tender compassion of our God:
the dawn from on high shall break upon us,
to shine on those who dwell in darkness and the shadow of death:
and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
Glory to the Father, Son and the Holy Spirit; as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

item.title: Song of Paul
item.stanza: You are the image of the invisible God,
the first born over all creation.
By you, O Christ, were all things created.
in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible
Thrones and dominions, powers and principalities:
were created through you and for you.
You are before everything and
in you all things hold together.
You are the head of your body, the Church
you are the beginning, the first born from the dead,
that over everything you may be supreme.
Glory to the Father, to the Son and to the Holy Spirit; as it was in the beginning, is now and ever shall be. Amen.

section.title: The Song of Jesus, Song of the Church or the Song of Revelation

item.title: Song of Jesus
item.stanza: Love your enemies:
do good to those who hate you,
bless those who curse you:
pray for those who ill-treat you.
For I was hungry and you gave me something to eat:
I was thirsty and you gave me something to drink.
I was a stranger and you invited me in:
I needed clothes and you clothed me.
I was sick and you looked after me:
I was in prison and you came to visit me.
The blind receive sight:
the lame walk, lepers are cured.
The deaf hear, the dead are raised:
the good news is preached to the poor,
and blessed are those not offended at me.
Glory to the Father, the Lord of heaven and earth:
Glory to the Son, to whom all things are given.
Glory to the Spirit, in whom the Son rejoices,
Now and for ever. Amen.

item.title: Te Deum Laudamus (Song of the Church)
item.stanza: You are God and we praise you:
you are the Lord and we acclaim you.
You are the eternal Father:
creation worships you.
To you all angels, all the powers of heaven:
Cherubim and seraphim sing in endless praise,
Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of power and might:
heaven and earth are full of your glory.
The glorious company of apostles praise you:
the noble fellowship of prophets praise you
the white-robed army of martyrs praise you.
Throughout the world the holy Church acclaims you:
Father of majesty unbounded;
your true and only Son worthy of all worship:
and the Holy Spirit advocate and guide.
You Christ are the King of glory:
the eternal Son of the Father.
When you became man to set us free:
you did not abhor the Virgin's womb.
You overcame the sting of death:
and opened the kingdom of heaven to all believers.
You are seated at God's right hand in glory.
We believe that you will come and be our judge.
Come then Lord and help your people;
bought with the price of your own blood;
and bring us with your saints:
to glory everlasting.
Save your people Lord and bless your inheritance:
govern and uphold them now and always.
Day by day we bless you:
we praise your name for ever.
Keep us today Lord from all sin:
have mercy on us Lord, have mercy.
Lord show us your love and mercy:
for we put our trust in you.
In you Lord is our hope:
let us not be confounded at the last.

item.title: Song of Revelation
item.stanza: Alleluia! For the Lord our God the Almighty reigns:
Let us rejoice and be glad and give him the glory.
Worthy is the Lord our God:
for he created everything.
Worthy is the Lamb who was slain:
for by his blood he ransomed us for God from every tribe and tongue, people and nation.
Great and wonderful are your deeds, Lord God the Almighty:
just and true are your ways, O king of ages!
Who shall not fear and praise your name O Lord?
For you alone are holy.
Nations shall come and worship in your presence:
for your just deeds have been revealed.
To him who sits on the throne and to the lamb
be blessing and honour, glory and might,
for ever and ever. Amen.

section.title: Apostles' Creed
section.item: We stand together with Christians throughout the centuries, and throughout the world today, to affirm our faith in the words of the Apostles' Creed:

item.stanza: I believe in God, the Father Almighty,
creator of heaven and earth.
I believe in Jesus Christ, his only Son, our Lord,
who was conceived by the Holy Spirit,
born of the Virgin Mary,
suffered under Pontius Pilate,
was crucified, died and was buried;
he descended to the dead.
On the third day he rose again;
he ascended into heaven,
he is seated at the right hand of the Father,
and he will come to judge the living and the dead.
I believe in the Holy Spirit,
the holy catholic Church,
the communion of saints,
the forgiveness of sins,
the resurrection of the body,
and the life everlasting. Amen.

hallowed be your name.
Your kingdom come,
your will be done,
on earth as in heaven.
Give us today our daily bread.
Forgive us our sins,
be as we forgive those who sin against us.
Lead us not into temptation

the power and the

your kingdom come your will be done,
hallowed be your name,
hallowed be your name.

hallowed be your name,
give us this day our daily bread,
hallowed be your name,
hallowed be your name.

hallowed be your name,
As we forgive those who trespass against us,
hallowed be your name,
hallowed be your name.

section.item: Show us your mercy, O Lord;
and grant us your salvation.
O Lord, guide our President;
and give him your wisdom and justice.
May your ministers serve you faithfully;
and your royal people joyfully.
In the valley of the shadow of death;
protect us with your rod and staff.
Like trees planted by the waterside;
grant us the fruit of your Spirit.
Send us out as the salt of the earth;
and as the light of the world.
May the earth be filled with your glory;
as the waters cover the sea.

section.title: Prayer for peace
section.rubric: Either

item.stanza: Almighty and everlasting God,
Father of the Prince of peace,
in returning and rest we are saved,
in quietness and trust is our strength.
Grant us the blessing of making peace,
and the joy of seeking justice.
Take from our souls all strain and stress,
and let our ordered lives confess,
the beauty of your peace;
through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

item.title: Or
item.stanza: O God, creator of peace and lover of unity,
through knowing you we have eternal life,
and in serving you we find perfect freedom.
Defend us in all attacks of our enemies,
so that trusting only in your defence,
we may be free from all fear;
through the power of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

section.title: Prayer for grace
section.rubric: Either

item.stanza: Almighty God,
You have been our Guard through the night,
keep us in your care through the day;
walking in the light, bearing witness to your way,
seeking first your kingdom and seeing you in everyone;
guide us in the footsteps of your Son,
and lead us on the path to your everlasting Day;
through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

item.title: Or
item.stanza: Lord our heavenly Father,
Almighty and ever living God,
who has brought us safely to the beginning of this day.
Protect us today with your mighty power,
so that we do not fall into any sin, or meet any danger;
but all our deeds may be directed by you,
and that we may do every day what is good in your sight;
through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

section.title: Prayerful choruses (or hymns) may be sung.

item.stanza: Almighty God,
you rule all nations and direct them according to your will.
We pray that you will guide our President
and all leaders of our country,
so that they may always use the authority
which you have given them for the peace of the world,
the benefit, honour and development of our nation,
and the good of your holy Church;
through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
Almighty and eternal God,
the only source of power.
Grant to our bishops, pastors and all
the people of our churches
your health-giving Spirit of grace;
and, in order that they may truly please you,
pour on them the continual dew of your blessing.
Grant this for the sake of our advocate and
mediator, Jesus Christ. Amen.

section.rubric: A moment of silent intercession may be observed. The leader then uses the following prayer:

item.stanza: Your silence is full, irresistible;
your presence is joy unspeakable.
drifting into mind
we lift to you and pray they find
health in sickness,
life in deadness,
strength in weakness,
light in darkness.
Their loss you bear, mysteriously;
your peace you share, eternally. Amen.
Almighty God,
by your grace we have come together at this time
to bring our united prayers to you;
and you have promised by your Son Jesus Christ,
that where two or three are gathered in his name
he will be in the midst of them.
Fulfil now, O Lord,
our desires and petitions as may be best for us;
granting us in this world knowledge of your truth,
and in the world to come life everlasting;
through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

section.item: All things come from you O Lord.

section.item: May the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that by the power of the Holy Spirit, you may abound in hope: And the blessing of God Almighty, the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit, be among you and remain with you always. Amen.

section.rubric: Or

section.rubric: Or

section.rubric: Or

section.rubric: Or

your maize and beans, your rice and potatoes,
your tea and coffee.

your cattle and camels,
to your sheep and goats,

May the Lord of all life bless your families:
your husbands and wives,
your sons and daughters,
your brothers and sisters.
May the Lord of mercy have compassion on:
our sick ones in hospitals and at home,
who mourn your loved ones,
and all orphans and widows.
And the blessing of God Almighty,
the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit,
be among you and remain with you always. Amen.

section.item: Let us join together in the words of the Grace:

the love of God,
and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit,
be with us now and forever more. Amen.

section.rubric: Or
section.item: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God our Father, who loved us and gave eternal comfort and good hope through grace, comfort our hearts and establish them in every good work and word.

item.stanza: And may the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ,
the love of God,
and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit,
be with us now and forever more. Amen.

section.title: The Commandments
section.item: Hear the commandments of God and take them to heart. I am the Lord your God who brought you out of the house of bondage. You shall have no other gods me.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.

You shall not make for yourself a graven image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above, or on the earth beneath, or what is in the water under the earth; you shall not bow down to them or serve them.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain for the Lord will not hold him guiltless who takes His name in vain.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.

Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy. Six days you shall labour, and do all your work; but the seventh day is a Sabbath of the Lord your God; in it you shall not do any work, you, or your son, or your maidservant, or your cattle, or the sojourner who is within your gates; for in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day; therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and hallowed it.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
Honour your father and your mother that your days may be long in the land which the Lord your God gives you.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not kill.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not commit adultery.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not steal.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not bear false witness against your neighbour.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not covet your neighbour's house: you shall not covet your neighbour's wife, or his manservant, or his maidservant, or his ox, or his ass, or anything that is your neighbour's.
Amen. Lord have mercy and write these laws hearts, we pray.

section.title: The New Testament Interpretation of the Law
section.rubric: This section may be shared by two leaders: one to read the Old Testament version and the other the New Testament rendering of the law.
section.item: Our Lord Jesus Christ said, if you love me, keep my commandments; blessed are those who hear the word of God and keep it. Hear therefore, what God has commanded his people: I am the Lord your God: you shall have no other gods but me.
You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind and with all your strength.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not make for yourself any idol.
God is spirit and those who worship him must worship him in spirit and in truth.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not dishonour the name of the Lord your God.
You shall worship him with awe and reverence.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
Remember the Lord's day and keep it holy.
Christ is risen from the dead: set your minds on things that are above, not on things that are on the earth.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
Honour your father and your mother.
If anyone does not provide for his relatives, and especially for his own family, he has disowned the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not commit murder.
Everyone who is angry with his brother shall be liable to judgement.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not commit adultery.
Anyone who looks at another lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not steal.
Let the thief labour, doing honest work with his hands, so that he may be able to give to those in need.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not be a false witness.
Let everyone speak the truth.
Amen. Lord have mercy and give us grace to keep this law.
You shall not covet anything which belongs to your neighbour.
It is more blessed to give than to receive. Love your neighbour as yourself, for love is the fulfilling of the law.
Amen. Lord have mercy and write these laws in our hearts, we pray.
Or

section.title: The Summary of the Law
section.item: Our Lord Jesus Christ said: The first and great commandment is this:
“Hear, O Israel, the Lord our God is the only Lord. You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind and with all your strength."
The second is this: Love your neighbour as yourself.' There is no other commandment greater than these.
Amen. Lord have mercy and write these laws in our hearts, we pray.

section.title: The Nicene Creed
section.rubric: Introduced by the words:
section.item: We stand together with Christians throughout the centuries, and throughout the world today, to affirm our faith in the words of the Nicene Creed.

item.stanza: We believe in one God,
the Father, the Almighty,
maker of heaven and earth,
of all that is seen and unseen.
We believe in one Lord, Jesus Christ,
the only Son of God,
eternally begotten of the Father,
God from God, Light from Light,
true God from true God,
begotten, not made,
of one Being with the Father.
Through him all things were made.
For us and for our salvation
he came down from heaven;
by the power of the Holy Spirit
he became incarnate of the Virgin Mary, and was made man.
For our sake he was crucified under Pontius Pilate;
He suffered, died, and was buried.
On the third day he rose again
in accordance with the Scriptures;
he ascended into heaven
and is seated at the right hand of the Father.
He will come again in glory
to judge the living and the dead,
and his kingdom will have no end.
We believe in the Holy Spirit,
the Lord, the giver of life,
who proceeds from the Father and the Son.
With the Father and the Son he is worshipped and glorified.
He has spoken through the Prophets.
We believe in one holy, catholic,
and apostolic Church.

for the forgiveness of sins.
We look for the resurrection of the dead,
and the life of the world to come. Amen.

section.title: Prayers of Penitence
section.item: Hear the words of challenge and comfort our saviour Christ says to all who follow him.
Luke 9:23-24If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself, take up his cross and follow me. For whoever save his life will lose it; and whoever loses his life for my sake will save it.
Matthew 11:28Come to me all of you who are tired of carrying heavy loads, and I will give you rest.
So, all of you who repent of your sins, who love you neighbours and intend to lead a new life, following the way of Jesus, come with faith and take this holy sacrament to strengthen you.
So let us reverently confess our sins to the Almighty.

Almighty God, creator of all, you marvellously made us in your image; but we have corrupted ourselves and damaged your likeness by rejecting your love and hurting our neighbours. We have done wrong and neglected to do right. We are sincerely sorry and heartily repent of our sins. Cleanse us and forgive us by the sacrifice of your Son; Remake us and lead us by your Spirit, the Comforter. We ask this through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

Almighty God, whose steadfast love is as great as the heavens are high above the earth, remove your sins from you as far as the east is from the west, strenghten your life in his kingdom and keep you upright to last day, through Jesus Christ our merciful High Priest.
Amen.
